channel.title: Strings on Notes
channel.description: Recent content in Strings on Notes

item.title: Go Strings
item.description: What is a string String is a read-only slice of bytes. A string can hold arbitrary bytes not just UTF-8 text or any other predefined format. Here is a string literal that uses the \xNN notation (hex values of a byte range from 00 to FF): const sample = "\xbd\xb2\x3d\xbc\x20\xe2\x8c\x98" Printing strings // Print the string directly. fmt.Print(sample) // ��=� ⌘ // Get individual bytes by looping over the string.
